name: unirrigated
content:

not supplied with water taken from another place, for example by pipes, so that crops and plants will grow: The majority of the agricultural land in the country is unirrigated. As well as the rice fields, they also farm a number of unirrigated fields. Synonym
non-irrigatedRelated word
irrigate
More examplesFewer examplesThe unirrigated soil on the hillsides was parched during the heatwave, leaving little for the livestock to eat.They bought 20 acres of unirrigated land and knew that they would have to build an irrigation system if they were to grow the crops they wanted.Fruit growers in this area can rely on regular rainfall so their orchards can be left unirrigated.
